title: Team Silvo

moderator: Grace Teo, Open Style Lab, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, MIT

segmentation: So let's get started.
So I wanted to start with Silvers team.
Over is over here.
The last five days that I've gotten to know him in some of our conversations, he's been really humorous and really fun to be around.
And just really great client to work with its.
I'm also pretty sure that Sovos is really good at painting.
If you go on his website you can see lots of paintings that yes meet.
I mean he's a member of the Association of Hand and Foot, Hand and foot painters.
Yes, so he's very accomplished.
It's been a privilege to work with him.
And so when we first met Silver, and when the team first met, Sovaldi identified certain challenges.
That's overhead.
So first of all, he usually got cold in this canoe region over here and in the lower back or in the middle of the back.
His jackets are pretty difficult to put on.
His hands, will get cold easily and then the mittens are also difficult to put on because servers hence are stuck in a certain position right now and then.
As I said before, the Jackets are too short for sitting in the back 'cause he's a wheelchair user and he had a very limited choice of jacket designs that he could choose from.
Sometimes his jackets so let rain protection from the rain and the material of the jacket was also extremely important because the synthetic materials could irritate his skin.
So what's out there right now?
In particular, you know the the coldness was a problem, so.

I looked into what kind of jackets out there that might provide heating, and they're actually, you know, motorcycle jackets that have these fabric pictures, but you can run an electric current through the heat up and they were warm and the the person who is using the jacket.
And we did some research in it.
We actually found out that in some cases it has burnt wheelchair users because especially in the back if there is a lack of airflow because just sitting up against the chair.
It over heats and then it can burn the skin.
So going into this we were aware of the safety risks.
So there was that jacket that we could learn from.
And then we also wanted to learn just from Silver himself.
What are the Jackets is currently using?
So there are three different jackets that Silver and Helen are brought to us to see, and the team managed to look through them and score them over 4 different success metrics.
So was it appealing to sailboat he like wearing it?
Was it attractive?
The aesthetic of it?
Was it warm?
Was it comfortable?
And then was it short enough in the front and long enough in the back?
And so, as you can see, all the jackets pass but barely not very good.
You're not doing very well.
So what the team decided to do was stay.
They set these success metrics for themselves.
They said jacket will have to be festival aesthetically pleasing.
It's going to have to be warm, is going to have to be comfortable.
The length has to be right and finally the fifth thing was that they wanted to make sure that it was easy for the jacket to be put on.
So right now Helena puts on clothes silver every single day and it takes a lot of time sometimes to put on his coat.
If he's sitting in a chair.
So.
This is the final product that the team made is a very attractive jacket.
You can see it over then.
I'm sure you have your voice to get after the workshop as well.
I described it in American slang is being bad as an I don't know what the European Slovene translation is, but that was my best way of saying it's really cool.
And so I want to go through the different design features that we put into this jacket.
And also their process throughout it.
So they wanted to make sure that it was aesthetically very appealing to silver, and so they asked over actually to send pictures to them of that kind of jackets that he liked.
And he sent these two pictures over here.
So I think you have really good taste and then you can see Jensen working over there from over there working on her laptop where you were trying to replicate this quoted pattern at the store.
And then they tested it with silver.
They gave him lots of different quote, tendency to use green thread to use Plex, Redden.
I went back and forth with what kind of aesthetics over liked.
Then he wanted to look at how easy it was to dress and where the problems were and how to solve it.
I'm going to show you a video here.
A short clip of Helen addressing silver.
So as you can see, she's putting the right hand through the armhole.
And this was an unfinished record, so that's I didn't have a sleeve.
And then once both hands were through the armholes, you can pull it over the head.
And that motion of pulling over the head is what I want you to observe.
So it actually took no longer than that this.
Joe has been spread out, but because of that motion of pulling over the head, what a team decided to do was to put this ribbed knit stretchy material.
Around the armhole so that when the Jackal was pulled over to hit there would be more give and way more space to go over his head, which is very smart.
They said one of decided other features was protection from rain, so they made sure to use a waterproof fabric.

They also incorporated a hood and one of the things I want to point out about a heard is that it can actually be zipped back into the collar once silvos is done using it and they used a very very thin material in the hood so that there wouldn't be interference between servos head and his back rest.
Another thing was that you know we're talking about the length, so they for the back hem of the jacket.
That elongated it so that it could slip just enough and silvos boecher question, which was nice 'cause it prevented air from entering the body from there.
And then finally, as I said, we were looking at how to heat up the jacket, and so we took a motorcycle jacket.
This is a motorcycle jacket that I actually bought in America.
And.
What the team did was to tear the jacket apart and take out all the heating pads so you can see the jacket comes with four different heating pads.
Over here we couldn't tell whether or not it was working, so that's why everyone here has pinned it to herself.
She took the risk to pin it to herself and then we turned it on to see how warm she would get and she got very warm so we knew was working and so now these heating pads are actually incorporated.
Into the lining of the jacket as well.
The last thing that the team did was to also create this device here.
So in fact the jacket initially came with this battery.
Sorry that battery on the bottom left so you had you had to press the button with your hand to turn it on.
Basically, and since Salvo is able to use his handphone his mobile phone, what the team did was to make a Bluetooth.
Device so that silver would be able to control his mobile phone an use debt to turn on and off his heating in his jacket.
OK.

I'm near the end, but one of the last things was also looking at the way they designed the sleeve cuffs, so this was very interesting to me because at first when you know they when the team started off they thought were going to make a jacket that looks like this and they're going to be little mittens that attached to the jacket and they will look like pockets, but they can be taken off and act as mittens and so this is the first prototype of a mid and you can see here, but the team wasn't happy with how it looked.
And so they said, OK, maybe we make it look just like a pocket and will stick into the jacket.

But just before they were going to try this second prototype, they put the product that sleeve jacket with the sleeve on silver and they just happened to realize that the sleeve cuff with the rib knit was actually long enough already to cover over his hand and so did it.
Send it.
Oh, we don't actually need pockets.
We accidentally found our solution and now.
We can just take this sleeve cuff and pull it over his hands and will keep it warm.

So I thought that was kind of an interesting part of the design process, but you never know what you're going to do, what's going to happen, and you just have to kind of be lookout for solutions sometimes and be surprised.
Right so at the end of the day, they ask Silver for his feedback on the jacket and you can see that in every single one of these metrics, Silver gave very high marks.
I believe so.
You don't really give 10, so you.
So you can.

You can see that there sometimes, but I think they've done accidentally and the most wonderful partners, so we're seeing that the time it took to put on the jacket was very, very comparable with the rest of the checkers he's currently bearing.
So I would say it's been a fabulous success and well done to the team, alright?
So maybe will.
What we're going to do is just a Gentoo question and answer session, so if anyone has questions for the team for the design process, we will take questions.
Maybe does it work?
Yet maybe grace?
Can you go over here and show the jacket also with the team?
Or if somebody of the team can stand up and take their jacket and show it?
Jensen so Jensen if you are.
If you're talking the one who is talking has to hold the mic, otherwise it won't work and my colleague there is has a mic.
So who wants to talk should hold the mic, otherwise we won't hear you.
OK, who will talk?
Every.
Come talk.
Yes.
Yeah.
So are there any questions?
Where exactly?
So it's underneath and all the wires which only comes out here.
And the battery should be on.
Not not right now.
On this one, but it's not attached to this one yet.
I mean, it's attachable, but it's not here actually there about the size of the silver fabric that you see here.
Sorry, the heating pads are about the size of the silver fabric here, and this fabric is conductive, right?
Fabric is cool tidbits silver, so silver is just kind of melted and the fabric is just dipped into the silver.
I mean this is already done.
Fabric wouldn't do it here, but this is a kind of more conductive fabric that that can make silver.
Still was buddy more heated so it's kind of microfibers an the pet says micro wires, so that's the kind of padding heating system.
Not to get burned, Are you sure?
How to if that was a possibility that you could get burned on this?
We can sing.
Excuse me, can you?
Can it happen that he?
He burns on the decade.
There is one of the metrics that we couldn't really test 'cause we weren't quite sure how the jacket works, but right now that has a threshold for how hot it gets.
And so I think it's just too hot right now.
So while we were testing it today, we found out that the highest heat level is pretty warm in Silver, got worn pretty fast, so we did turn it down.
It didn't burn him, but I think in the future you'll probably design a jacket that has a lower threshold.
OK.
Sorry, electricity also in the battery on the wheelchair.
Is it possible?
Oh the Mike.
It is possible there is.
We actually tested today.
We can plug in the Bluetooth device that will control the heated jacket right into the back.
It's a 5 Volt outlet so it's simple USB connection.
OK, thank you Tim Silva.
Yeah, that is me.
Will set and there's some low-cost Turbo team to grammar.
